column12: A rounded concrete object with a metal pipe going through it partially buried in the ground

Strip of concrete that runs west, then north, then east, potentially the outline foundation of some sort of structure. The wall is roughly 30 cm / 1 foot wide and 8 cm / 4 inches tall. Calling this Concrete Foundation 1 / Feature 1.
Small concrete block near Shovel Test B-2
Cement block found at Spartan Village - eastern portion near Harrison Rd.
Another concrete pad with pole sticking out
Linear concreate feature, possibly a foundation?
Possible foundation of house. One meter away is at least 4 cinder blocks on a line

In area revealed by construction scraping. Only have removed 2 or 3 feet.  Scatter of bricks in south eastern portion of the site, roughly 30 meters west of Harrison Road. Several types of bricks - red, deep purplish-red, and yellow. All broken. This is the largest concentration of brick, but there are broken bricks scattered throughout exposed area. Ceramic drain pipe also found in exposed area.

Earthenware object decorated with floral / botanical motif. Likely either a large flower planter base or a birdbath. Also found near this object was a red glazed whiteware, cut stone, and lots of brick. Fresh break in earthenware object, one piece 5 meters to the south, likely broken and moved by scraping that happen today.
Stoneware container sherd located near a few pieces of concrete
Buried stoneware drain tile, roughly 4 in diameter. Runs roughly west by north west / east by south east. Exposed by backhoe scraping. Collected a few pieces.

Foundation 1, foundation of one of the outbuildings on the property. Quite west of where house was. Scraping work by construction crews exposed additional parts of the fountain. Believe all corners mostly visible. North west corner still buried, had to take location where exposed, but could presumably extend corner to make rectangle based on position of NE corner.

Found a second foundation just 1 meter south of foundation 1. Will call this foundation 2, though it is possible it is associated with foundation 1. This foundation is much smaller and the cement is much fiber and of better quality than that used in Foundation 1. The foundation is rectangular and the long sides are oriented north-south.

Length of foundation - 2.75 m
Width of foundation - 1.35 m
Thickness of foundation walls - 15 cm
Auger core taken in south half of Foundation 2. Taken down to 45 cmbs and at least 2 feet of soil has been removed by machine scraping. Found one shard of brown container glass at 26 cmbs.
Auger core taken in the south west corner of foundation 1. Went down 39 cmbs and hit light colored sand. NCM
Auger core in the north side of Foundation 2, down to 41 cmbs before hitting rock. Seems to be in subsoil. Found shards of a bottle, slightly green tinted, at 28 cmbs.

column17:
All taken dry: 0 - 24 cmbs 10YR 3/3
24 - 35 cmbs 10YR 4/3
35 - 64 cmbs 10 YR 4/4
64 84 cmbs 10 YR 5/3
column18:
0 - 24 cmbs sandy loam
24 - 35 cmbs clay loam
35 - 64 cmbs clay 
64 84 cmbs silty clay
column20:
0 - 24 cmbs: plastic cup rim, brick, coal, colorless glass, sheet plastic

24 - 35 cmbs: plastic sheeting (2), metal lid with plastic seal, colorless bottle finish (4), colorless body glass (2), cement (1, not saved), ferrous metal (2).

35 - 64 cmbs: colorless bottle /jar base (3), colorless container finish (2), colorless glass fragments (13), colorless glass tumbler with applied color label, glass or plastic tube, plastic sheeting (3), black glass insulator tip, brick (3), ferrous metal (2), plastic children's cup, colorless glass jar, colorless jar 

64 - 84 cmbs: colorless glass fragments (7), ferrous metal (2), sheet plastic,
column23: Excavated until hit rock / concrete at 84 cmbs. Artifacts in all layers, including sheet plastic. Most artifacts came from strata 3 (35 - 64 cmbs). Will come back tomorrow and bisect whole foundation as a single feature.

column12: Cement foundation and ceramic drain pipe.  Likely house foundation, buried 8 to 10 feet below surface. Pipe is running north south

With all corners of foundation 1 exposed this is the final measurement. Took a photo of north wall and close up of north west corner. North west corner of foundation 1 is roughly 1 meter south of the south east corner of foundation 3. Photo of this also taken with trowel blade for north arrow.

A concrete foundation one meter north of foundation 1. Cannot tell orientation, but position seems to match the second out building seen in aerials ca. 1955. Will call this foundation  3. South east corner of foundation 3 is roughly 1.5 meters (142 cm) north of north west corner of foundation 2, they almost directly line up. 

Took photos of this feature, looking west. They show east and south wall and the position of foundation 3 related to foundation 1. All with photo board and trowel as north arrow.
Cement foundation and ceramic drain pipe. Likley house foundation, buried 8 to 10 feet below surface. Pipe is running north south

Concrete floor, possibly basement floor. One small portion decorated with cut stone set into the concrete, but rest of it plain. Also there is a concrete wall, north wall was still intact, west wall removed. Can see where west wall would have run into north wall and the floor. There is a brick outline in the floor with dark soil and charcoal. Took point of se corner of exposed floor and took geo shape of bricks. Brick feature is 2m long and 70 cm wide and may be base of chimney.
